newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Illovo opens upgraded S.African sugar mill.
newsitem.headline: Illovo opens upgraded S.African sugar mill.

text.p: South Africa's Illovo Sugar Ltd on Friday opened an upgraded sugar cane mill at Eston in the KwaZulu-Natal Midlands, relocating its milling operations to the heart of the sugar-growing area.

Managing director Don MacLeod said the crushing capacity at the relocated mill had been expanded from 200 to 230 tonnes of cane per hour (TCH) in order to accommodate an expanded annual crop of about 1.3 million tonnes.

"Further down the track, there is the promise of greater cane expansion up to a level of about 1.7 million tonnes and Phase Two of the Easton project will see crushing capacity once again enhanced to 380 TCH," he said.
That will lift Illovo production to over 200,000 tonnes of sugar, from a current annual average of 105,000 tonnes.
